Description: Body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style black figure pottery closed vessel, amphora or oinochoe; glaze fired orange-brown; pale slip; from top, black-figure decoration, possibly a duck; maeander frieze between wide bands with traces of bands in added white and red; glazed area.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 36, pl. 22, no. 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.048)
